net.hudup.core.data

Class Datasource

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.Datasource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AutoCloseable

    @NextUpdate(note="Testing whether variable dataset is serializable")
public class Datasource
extends java.lang.Object
implements AutoCloseable, java.io.Serializable
    Data source represented by Datasource class is a special class used to point to a dataset. Of course it contains a URI of such dataset. Note that URI, abbreviation of Uniform Resource Identifier, is the string of characters used to identify a resource on Internet. As usual and for convenience, data source also contains dataset. We can considered data source as a wrapper of dataset with additional information about dataset. It is possible that there are many data sources referring to the same dataset.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • dataset

        protected Dataset dataset
        The internal dataset.

      • uri

        protected xURI uri
        URI of the internal dataset referred by variable dataset.

      • autoClose

        protected boolean autoClose
        If true the dataset referred by variable dataset is closed after this data source is closed (by calling close() method). Otherwise, such dataset is not closed after this data source is closed (by calling close() method).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Datasource

        public Datasource()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(Dataset dataset)
        This method is used to connect this data source with the specified dataset. After this method is called, this data source is initialized; concretely, the internal variable dataset is assigned by the specified dataset and the internal variable uri is assigned by the URI of specified dataset and the internal variable autoClose is assigned by whether the specified dataset is exclusive.
        this.dataset = dataset;
        this.uri = dataset.getConfig().toUri();
        this.autoClose = dataset.isExclusive();
        Parameters:
        dataset - specified dataset.

      • connect

        public void connect(xURI uri)
        This method is used to connect this data source with the URI of specified dataset. After this method is called, this data source is initialized; concretely, the internal variable dataset is loaded from the specified URI and the internal variable uri is assigned by the specified URI and the internal variable autoClose is true.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of specified dataset.

      • getDataset

        public Dataset getDataset()
        Getting the internal dataset of this data source.
        Returns:
        internal dataset of this data source.

      • getUri

        public xURI getUri()
        Getting the URI of this data source.
        Returns:
        URI of this data source.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checking whether data source is valid. This data source is valid if its dataset is opened and its URI is not null.
        Returns:
        whether data source is valid.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: AutoCloseable
        The main method of this interface, which is responsible for releasing resources occupied by auto-closable object. The finalize() method of auto-closable class should call AutoCloseable.close() method so that AutoCloseable.close() method is called automatically before the Java garbage collector destroys auto-closable object.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
